content: In the world of literature, what pen name did Samuel Clemens use when writing classics such as "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" and "Huckleberry Finn"?

Samuel Clemens wrote under the pen name Mark Twain. His real name was Samuel Langhorne Clemens, and he was an American author and humorist who is widely considered one of the greatest writers in American literature. His works, including "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" and "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn," are known for their wit, satire, and deep social commentary. Mark Twain's writing style and themes have had a lasting impact on American culture and literature.
